STREAMM (Simulation Toolkit for Renewable Energy and Advanced Materials Modeling)¶

Advanced materials are important for a number of cutting edge renewable energy applications. These applications include organic polymer photovoltaics, thermoelectrics and organic radical batteries to name a few. The optimal synthesis of these materials and device fabrication spans a large parameter space that is a challenege for progress using only experimental investigation. Modeling and numerical simulation needs to be an integral part of the search for these critical materials.

The energy applications mentioned above combine a need to understand materials on a range of length and energy scales that requires a number of different kinds of simulation methodolgies and codes. STREAMM is a framework of python modules that enables

  • data containers that allow transfer between quantum chemistry and molecular dynamics simulations
  • an interface to the NREL Materials Database
  • integration with analysis and visualization algorithms (both internal and third-party)
  • an object-oriented framework for extending the functionality to specific needs
